ilo: perform confidently and independently as an individual and as a member of a cohesive small ensemble;
perform and refine selected repertoire to a professional standard;
make informed choices in matters of style, sonority, balance, ensemble, phrasing, blending and musical gesture;
lead and collaborate to a professional standard in rehearsal and performance contexts.
generic_skills: communicate effectively in oral and written language, and in musical performance;
demonstrate appropriate leadership in group settings;
promote and maintain the wellbeing of self and others;
manage competing demands on time, including self-directed project work.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Weekly preparation of parts, individual practice and active contribution to all rehearsals as directed
5-minute presentation on repertoire to be performed
15-minute professional-standard performance of chamber music repertoire

assessment.hurdle: Students must attend a minimum of 80% of all scheduled rehearsals as directed.
